snippet: Helen of Troy said on Monday that it plans to buy back nearly 29 percent of its outstanding stock for $550 million. But it isn’t clear whether Sachem Head Capital Management, the hedge fund looking to shake up the consumer products maker, will find...
abstract: Helen of Troy said on Monday that it plans to buy back nearly 29 percent of its outstanding stock for $550 million. But it isn’t clear whether Sachem Head Capital Management, the hedge fund looking to shake up the consumer products maker, will find it enough.

byline.original: By MICHAEL J. DE LA MERCED

headline.main: As Investor Calls for a Sale, Helen of Troy Unveils a Big Stock Buyback
